text: The Montenegrin–Ottoman War (1852–1853) started after the Ottoman Empire retaliated against Montenegro for secretly helping rebels in Herzegovina. ==Background== In 1852, Danilo, returning from Russia, declared himself "Prince of Montenegro and the Hills," changing Montenegro from a theocracy to a principality. Although Montenegro was still an Ottoman vassal, the Ottomans attacked after Montenegro's secret support for the Herzegovinian rebels was revealed. ==History== Omar Pasha and Osman Pasha of Scutari attacked Montenegro in November 1852. ==See also== *Montenegrin–Ottoman War (1876–1878) ==References== * *
title: Montenegrin–Ottoman War (1852–1853)
